comments: Using a fresh SuSE 8.0 install, downloaded and installed GTK: lib versions: pango-1.0.3-2gtk atk-1.0.3-1 glib2-2.0.4-1gtk gtk2-2.0.5-1gtk  Eclipse does not start but throws an Exception. I have tried earlier versions of pango but they throw a similar link exception as well. The motif build starts okay but when I try to open a Java Editor an error message pops up saying: "Could not create part". So I can not use Eclipse on Linux at the moment. This is extremely annoying. Can fix this very quickly please?   oglueck@gimli:~/bin/eclipse-gtk> ./eclipse java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/oglueck/bin/eclipse-gtk/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk_2.1.0/os/linux/x86/libswt-pi-gtk-2112.so: /usr/lib/libpangoxft-1.0.so.0: undefined symbol: FT_Stream_GetShort         at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1419)         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1327)         at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:749)         at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:820)         at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:104)         at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:19)         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.createDisplay(Display.java:404)         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.create(Display.java:398)         at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<init>(Device.java:103)         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:284)         at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:280)         at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)         at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:775)         at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)         at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)         at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)         at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)         at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

(oops something happend to the line breaks, so again:)

Using a fresh SuSE 8.0 install, downloaded and installed GTK:
lib versions:
pango-1.0.3-2gtk
atk-1.0.3-1
glib2-2.0.4-1gtk
gtk2-2.0.5-1gtk

Eclipse does not start but throws an Exception. I have tried earlier versions of
pango but they throw a similar link exception as well. The motif build starts
okay but when I try to open a Java Editor an error message pops up saying:
"Could not create part".

So I can not use Eclipse on Linux at the moment. This is extremely annoying. Can
fix this very quickly please?

oglueck@gimli:~/bin/eclipse-gtk> ./eclipse java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError:

This again.  GG, can you make a FAQ and post a link to it?  Not being able to 
run on Linux due to DLL hell (Motif - our DLL, GTK - our DLL and theirs) is a 
huge problem.  We need a section on our web page for this.  VI?

At least all the dependencies should be listed with exact versions (and maybe a
link to a download location). Thanks.

The FAQ lists the GTK dependencies:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-
home/faq.html#gtkstartup

There is also an FAQ about the dll hell on linux motif which I have a link to 
from the SWT FAQ page:
http://mmoebius.gmxhome.de/eclipse/downloads/mini-HOWTO.html

I could make our own section on the linux motif library issues.

I think you're missing the required version of Freetype.  I've just duplicated 
the FT_Stream_GetShort problem and then fixed it by upgrading my Freetype from 
2.0.9-2 to 2.1.2-7, using Eclipse 2.0.1.

If doing this on your end fixes your problem then please add a comment here.  
Thanks.

Assuming that this is a setup problem, changing to WORKSFORME.  If this is not 
the case then please reopen the report.
*** Bug 69790 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
